intro: Louiseania pedunculata, commonly known as the Florida starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in groups of three. Its fruit is a fleshy, star-shaped berry that turns red when mature. The plant is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
